definition: part work, part study/work-study program
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
work/worker/skill/profession/trade/craft/labor
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
comma/phrase marked by pause

sentences.english: I'm looking for a part job.
sentences.chinese: 我正在找一份半工半读的工作。

sentences.english: We can also choose to work part time, it is very tempered person.
sentences.chinese: 我们还可以选择半工半读，那是非常锻炼人的。

sentences.english: She had to work her way through law school.
sentences.chinese: 她必须半工半读学法律。

sentences.english: I went back at the end of four weeks, asking to begin the work-study program again.
sentences.chinese: 四周后我回去要求再加入半工半读计划。

sentences.english: I accepted a job as portion of a work-study program.
sentences.chinese: 于是我半工半读，找了一份工作。

sentences.english: She had to work her way through law school .
sentences.chinese: 她须半工半读学习法律。

sentences.english: Students are often older, work part time, and live far away from the campus.
sentences.chinese: 学生年龄略大一些，半工半读，住所远离校园。

sentences.english: That's what is call Work Study, isn't it?
sentences.chinese: 那就是所谓的半工半读吧？

definition: to work part time while studying/work-study program

to major (in a field)/to study a specialty to obtain a higher degree

to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
to attend (a school)/to drop out (of college etc)
to deny oneself comforts in order to save money for one's education
to suspend schooling/to defer study
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
to quit school
to pursue one's studies
evening school/night school
cost of living/living expenses/alimony
family livelihood/a household's economic situation/family property
